calls are generally pretty fast though

Hello! I'd like to know if there is a compilation of best practices when running a matic validation node. Are sentry nodes required, the what kind of kms do you use and so on !
hi guys any advice on how to monitor the nodes ?

Depends on your setup. If you have AWS, they have CloudWatch which can monitor the state of your nodes, and track activity and resource utilization. I’d assume GCP and Azure have something similar. You can use external services (I’m a fan of DataDog), which can monitor the state of apps running on your node (so if heimdall/bor quit on you, you’ll get a notification).
If I may, what's you average aws cost for a full node @AlgoRhythm ?

For a full node at the recommended spec (4CPU, 16GB RAM), it costs about $130 per month with a spot instance (no commitment, pay as you go, pay only for what you use). I’m looking into changing to a reserved instance (no longer a spot instance) which brings the cost to $73 per month with a 1 year commitment. There’s also a savings plan which is cheaper, but I still need to research that. You can check out your options on AWS’s calculator: https://calculator.aws/#/

embeds.title: AWS Pricing Calculator
embeds.description: AWS Pricing Calculator lets you explore AWS services, and create an estimate for the cost of your use cases on AWS.

Question: How can I get a span to be created?

I have created my own private chain in my local environment to check the behavior of the Validator and to study. (I don't use public test chains such as goerli)

https://docs.matic.network/docs/develop/advanced/deploy-your-own-matic-testnet/
I carried out up to step 5 while looking at this page.

If bor and heimdall continue to create blocks, bor will be on the way

"Retrying again in 5 seconds for next Heimdall span path = bor / span / 1"

Is output and block generation stops.

When I hit the API, it seems that span id = 1 is not created.

$ curl localhost: 1317 / bor / span / 1
{"error": "{\" codespace \ ": \" sdk \ ", \" code \ ": 1, \" message \ ": \" could not get span; span not found for id \ "}"

Also,

$ heimdallcli tx bor propose-span

I tried, but the span is not created

I haven't created span id = 1, but what kind of settings can I make span id = 1? Does anyone know?

embeds.title: Deploy your own Matic Testnet | Matic Network | Documentation
embeds.description: Build your next blockchain app on Matic.

messages.content:
I fixed above question m(_ _)m

- Bad

heimdallcli tx bor propose-span \
    --start-block 10 \
    --bor-chain-id 15001 \
    --span-id 1 \
    --chain-id heimdall-cs2008

- OK

heimdallcli tx bor propose-span \
    --start-block 256 \
    --bor-chain-id 15001 \
    --span-id 1 \
    --chain-id heimdall-cs2008

@danielp

systemctl stop heimdalld
systemctl stop heimdalld-rest-server

wget -c https://matic-blockchain-snapshots.s3.amazonaws.com/matic-mainnet/heimdall-snapshot-2021-03-02.tar.gz

mv ~/.heimdalld/data ~/.heimdalld/data.ORI
mkdir ~/.heimdalld/data
tar -xzvf /root/node-ansible/BACKUP/heimdall-snapshot-2021-03-02.tar.gz -C ~/.heimdalld/data/

systemctl start heimdalld
systemctl start heimdalld-rest-server
you need to make sure that Heimdall is synced completely and only then Start Bor. If you start Bor without Heimdall syncing completely, you will run into issues frequently

systemctl stop heimdalld
systemctl stop heimdalld-rest-server
systemctl stop bor

wget -c https://matic-blockchain-snapshots.s3.amazonaws.com/matic-mainnet/bor-snapshot-2021-03-01.tar.gz

mv ~/.bor/data/bor/chaindata ~/.bor/data/bor/chaindata.ORI
mkdir ~/.bor/data/bor/chaindata
tar -xzvf /root/node-ansible/BACKUP/heimdall-snapshot-2021-03-02.tar.gz -C ~/.bor/data/bor/chaindata

systemctl start heimdalld
systemctl start heimdalld-rest-server
systemctl start bor

One aspect of assembling a sentry knot
is that it serves as a protection layer where your validator node connects to it, the more sentry nodes you run, the more protection layers you will have, say you suffer a DDos attack who will be receiving all the stress load will be the sentry machines , its validator is invisible to the world, only the sentry sees it.
So sentry is essential.

You can enter a unique identifier, for example moniker = "my-sentry-node"
Just add to the seeds.

I think yes, currently I'm syncing "heimdalld" (I think it will take around 3-4 days with current speed). After that you need to run Bor. I will write a short description how I done that.

***How to install and sync Heimdall on Ubuntu***

**Download Heimdall**
```wget https://matic-public.s3.amazonaws.com/v0.2.0/matic-heimdall_0.2.0_amd64.deb```

**Install Heimdall**
```sudo dpkg -i matic-heimdall_0.2.0_amd64.deb```

**Setup node files**
```cd ~/
git clone https://github.com/maticnetwork/launch
cp -rf launch/mainnet-v1/sentry/sentry ~/node```

**Setup network directories**
```cd ~/node/heimdall
bash setup.sh```

**Setup config files**

Get your validator NodeID (copy the output)
```heimdalld tendermint show-node-id```

Here you will need to change some params
```sudo nano ~/.heimdalld/config/config.toml```

find **private_peer_ids** and paste your NodeID there (e.g. private_peer_ids = "2170800c8a57.....a350f1c0ff")

find **seeds=""** and set it to **f4f605d60b8ffaaf15240564e58a81103510631c@159.203.9.164:26656,4fb1bc820088764a564d4f66bba1963d47d82329@44.232.55.71:26656**

find **pex** and set it to **true**
find **prometheus** and set it to **true**
find **max_open_connections ** and set it to **100**

**Start Heimdall**

```heimdalld start --home "~/.heimdalld"```

If you move your Heimdall dir (~/.heimdalld) to other place, replace the --home param with the correct path.
You can create service with this command.

**To check if Heimdall is synced**
```curl localhost:26657/status```

In the output, **catching_up** value should be **false** (Heimdall  is fully synced)

Now once Heimdall is synced, you can run Bor (maybe I will write something like this for Bor)

Mar 18 10:32:15 deskmini systemd[1]: heimdalld.service: Failed with result 'exit-code'.```

messages.content: I built my knot through here

"It is essential that you have 2 different Machines / VM for your Sentry and Validator Node. Having a single Machine to run both, your Sentry and Validator no"
And why?
You need a bor and heimdall on each server, and I believe the apps would conflict if they were to be run on the same server

Because the sentinel will connect with the world and its validator will become private without access to the outside world. You just want to execute a knot, so in my view there is no need to execute a sentry.
But the ideal would be to confirm with someone on the team if it is possible

I found something interresting !!
If you don't want to use an other computer, you can use for your own computer

Do : `ansible-playbook --connection=local playbooks/network.yml --extra-var="bor_branch=v0.2.1 heimdall_branch=v0.2.0-mainnet-1d8aca37 network_version=mainnet-v1 node_type=sentry/sentry"
`
Instead of :`ansible-playbook -l sentry playbooks/network.yml --extra-var="bor_branch=v0.2.1 heimdall_branch=v0.2.0-mainnet-1d8aca37 network_version=mainnet-v1 node_type=sentry/sentry"`
The main difference is in the use of `--connection=local`
I hope it is going to be helpful for someone, I spend 4 days to try to install bor 🥲

Not that I knew of, but you can run a validation node and try to enter the network as a validator

So I'm using the bootnodes from this message => https://discord.com/channels/635865020172861441/755816485951373422/832669467799978045
I ran `bor init` with the genesis.json file from the launch repo, then run this command
```
bor --datadir ~/volumes/bor \
  --port 30303 \
  --http --http.addr '0.0.0.0' \
  --http.vhosts '*' \
  --http.corsdomain '*' \
  --http.port 8545 \
  --syncmode 'full' \
  --networkid '137' \
  --miner.gaslimit '200000000' \
  --miner.gastarget '20000000' \
  --txpool.nolocals \
  --txpool.accountslots '128' \
  --txpool.globalslots '20000'  \
  --txpool.lifetime '0h16m0s' \

messages.content: A block occurs every 2 seconds. Being off by a block or two is normal just from the speed blocks are produced. Any modern SSD should be acceptable.
Thank you
I know theirs only 9 validators left. How do they pick them? Is it hard to get on board?
First come, first serve. After that, a non-validator can replace an active validator through an "Auction", which essentially means the new validator has a higher self-stake than the current validator
For some reason my node is being late sometimes for 1 block in comparison with maticvigil node. Why it could be so?
cant understand why it is normal to being off by a block or two
Does this get in the way of anything you’re doing? I would consider a block or two difference (literally a 2 second difference) being just latency in the network.
